Class Cordinate

java.lang.Object
org.mio.progettoingsoft.Cordinate
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Cordinate extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a coordinate (row, column) on a game board. This class ensures that coordinates are within a predefined valid range and provides utility methods for equality, hashing, finding adjacent coordinates, and iterating through all possible coordinates. Coordinates are serializable for persistence.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Cordinate

      public Cordinate(int row, int column) throws InvalidCordinate
      Constructs a new Cordinate object.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index.
      column - The column index.
      Throws:
      InvalidCordinate - if the provided row or column is outside the valid range [0, maxRow] or [0, maxCol].

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Compares this Cordinate object with another object for equality. Two Cordinate objects are considered equal if they have the same row and column values.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to compare with.
      Returns:
      true if the objects are equal, false otherwise.

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Returns a hash code value for this Cordinate object. The hash code is based on the row and column values.
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object
      Returns:
      The hash code.

    • getAdjacent

      public List<Cordinate> getAdjacent()
      Returns a list of valid adjacent coordinates (up, down, left, right). Coordinates that fall outside the board boundaries are not included in the list.
      Returns:
      A List of Cordinate objects representing valid adjacent positions.

    • getIterator

      public static Iterator<Cordinate> getIterator()
      Returns a static Iterator that can iterate through all possible valid Cordinate objects on the board, starting from (0,0) and proceeding row by row.
      Returns:
      An iterator for Cordinate objects.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the Cordinate in a user-friendly format, adding offsets to the row and column for display purposes (e.g., (Row + 5, Col + 4)).
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A formatted string like "(R+5, C+4)".

    • realValue

      public String realValue()
      Returns a string representation of the Cordinate displaying its actual internal values.
      Returns:
      A string like "( R, C )".
